route_summary.feasibility_assessment: This route is feasible and utilizes the Bristol & Bath Railway Path, a popular off-road cycle route.

steps.instruction: Start at Bristol Temple Meads Station. Head east towards the Bristol & Bath Railway Path.
steps.notes: Follow signs for the Bristol & Bath Railway Path.

steps.instruction: Join the Bristol & Bath Railway Path.
steps.notes: This is a mostly flat, traffic-free path. Be mindful of other cyclists and pedestrians.

steps.instruction: Continue on the Bristol & Bath Railway Path, passing through Bitton and Saltford.
steps.notes: There are cafes and pubs along the route in these villages if you need a break.

steps.instruction: As you approach Bath, the path will lead you closer to the River Avon.
steps.notes: Enjoy the scenic views of the river.

steps.instruction: Exit the Bristol & Bath Railway Path near Bath Spa Train Station.
steps.notes: Follow signs for the city centre and Bath Spa Train Station.

steps.instruction: Arrive at Bath Spa Train Station.

recommendations: Stop at the Dundas Aqueduct for a picturesque view.
Visit the Avon Valley Railway in Bitton.
Take a break at one of the pubs along the route in Saltford.
safety_concerns: Be aware of other cyclists and pedestrians on the shared path.
Wear appropriate clothing and be visible to other path users.
Check your bike's brakes and tires before setting off.
Carry water and snacks, especially during warmer weather.
